description: Production Supervisor * Kingston, ON * Full-time permanent position, with rotating shifts including nights and weekends * Commensurate with experience * Food manufacturing experience required * Dairy processing experience is an asset Are you looking for a stable position that will allow you to apply your hands-on team building skills and in-depth production knowledge in a brand-new production environment? We’re Canada Royal Milk: an advanced manufacturing company that will be the sole producer of baby formula in Canada. Our new plant is entering commercial production and we are looking for experienced leaders ready to take the next step in their career. Your tasks will include: * Provide leadership and supervision to staff by providing work direction, performance feedback, and recommendations for training and development * Promote a positive working environment, including continuously improving/maintaining the team culture and establishing high levels of employee involvement; * Troubleshoot milk receiving, process, pre-treatment, evaporation and drying areas by identifying and analyzing process problems and advising and guiding processing operators on action required to resolve process system malfunctions in order to ensure efficient running of the plant * Ensure planning and effective implementation of sanitary/mechanical maintenance and preventive maintenance programs and schedules * Follow and administer Quality Policies and Procedures including food safety, HAACP, POGS, traceability, and production hold investigations Working with Canada Royal Milk The best part of working at Canada Royal Milk will be your opportunity to shape it. We’ll be spending the next few months developing our team, and as an early member, you’ll have plenty of input. That means you’ll contribute to our success in many ways: everything from shaping our team and processes, to execution and growth. Qualifications * Demonstrated leadership and supervisory experience: ability to influence and engage employees * Prior technical experience in processing and packaging in food manufacturing * Exceptional English communication (verbal and written) skills required * Experience working in a dairy processing is desired * Knowledge of HACCP and other food safety procedures and regulations, including traceability and production hold investigations * Certified and/or experience in the supervisory responsibilities under WSIB, OSHA, and First Aid an asset * Post-secondary education in industrial engineering, automated production engineering, food engineering or other relevant discipline How to Apply Our online application gives you the chance to apply as more than just a resume. We’ll assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, which should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll be able to view your results. We strive to build diverse teams that reflect the community, and encourage applications from underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button. We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment and look forward to hearing from you.

title: Production Supervisor
description: Production Supervisor * Kingston, ON * Full-time permanent position, with rotating shifts including nights and weekends * Commensurate with experience * Food manufacturing experience required * Dairy processing experience is an asset Are you looking for a stable position that will allow you to apply your hands-on team building skills and in-depth production knowledge in a brand-new production environment? We’re Canada Royal Milk: an advanced manufacturing company that will be the sole producer of baby formula in Canada. Our new plant is entering commercial production and we are looking for experienced leaders ready to take the next step in their career. Your tasks will include: * Provide leadership and supervision to staff by providing work direction, performance feedback, and recommendations for training and development * Promote a positive working environment, including continuously improving/maintaining the team culture and establishing high levels of employee involvement; * Troubleshoot milk receiving, process, pre-treatment, evaporation and drying areas by identifying and analyzing process problems and advising and guiding processing operators on action required to resolve process system malfunctions in order to ensure efficient running of the plant * Ensure planning and effective implementation of sanitary/mechanical maintenance and preventive maintenance programs and schedules * Follow and administer Quality Policies and Procedures including food safety, HAACP, POGS, traceability, and production hold investigations Working with Canada Royal Milk The best part of working at Canada Royal Milk will be your opportunity to shape it. We’ll be spending the next few months developing our team, and as an early member, you’ll have plenty of input. That means you’ll contribute to our success in many ways: everything from shaping our team and processes, to execution and growth. Qualifications * Demonstrated leadership and supervisory experience: ability to influence and engage employees * Prior technical experience in processing and packaging in food manufacturing * Exceptional English communication (verbal and written) skills required * Experience working in a dairy processing is desired * Knowledge of HACCP and other food safety procedures and regulations, including traceability and production hold investigations * Certified and/or experience in the supervisory responsibilities under WSIB, OSHA, and First Aid an asset * Post-secondary education in industrial engineering, automated production engineering, food engineering or other relevant discipline How to Apply Our online application gives you the chance to apply as more than just a resume. We’ll assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, which should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll be able to view your results. We strive to build diverse teams that reflect the community, and encourage applications from underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button. We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment and look forward to hearing from you.

We’re Canada Royal Milk: an advanced manufacturing company that will be the sole producer of baby formula in Canada. Our new plant is entering commercial production and we are looking for experienced leaders ready to take the next step in their career. Your tasks will include: * Provide leadership and supervision to staff by providing work direction, performance feedback, and recommendations for training and development * Promote a positive working environment, including continuously improving/maintaining the team culture and establishing high levels of employee involvement; * Troubleshoot milk receiving, process, pre-treatment, evaporation and drying areas by identifying and analyzing process problems and advising and guiding processing operators on action required to resolve process system malfunctions in order to ensure efficient running of the plant * Ensure planning and effective implementation of sanitary/mechanical maintenance and preventive maintenance programs and schedules * Follow and administer Quality Policies and Procedures including food safety, HAACP, POGS, traceability, and production hold investigations Working with Canada Royal Milk The best part of working at Canada Royal Milk will be your opportunity to shape it. We’ll be spending the next few months developing our team, and as an early member, you’ll have plenty of input. That means you’ll contribute to our success in many ways: everything from shaping our team and processes, to execution and growth. Qualifications * Demonstrated leadership and supervisory experience: ability to influence and engage employees * Prior technical experience in processing and packaging in food manufacturing * Exceptional English communication (verbal and written) skills required * Experience working in a dairy processing is desired * Knowledge of HACCP and other food safety procedures and regulations, including traceability and production hold investigations * Certified and/or experience in the supervisory responsibilities under WSIB, OSHA, and First Aid an asset * Post-secondary education in industrial engineering, automated production engineering, food engineering or other relevant discipline How to Apply Our online application gives you the chance to apply as more than just a resume. We’ll assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, which should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll be able to view your results. We strive to build diverse teams that reflect the community, and encourage applications from underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button. We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment and look forward to hearing from you.

We’re Canada Royal Milk: an advanced manufacturing company that will be the sole producer of baby formula in Canada. Our new plant is entering commercial production and we are looking for experienced leaders ready to take the next step in their career. Your tasks will include: * Provide leadership and supervision to staff by providing work direction, performance feedback, and recommendations for training and development * Promote a positive working environment, including continuously improving/maintaining the team culture and establishing high levels of employee involvement; * Troubleshoot milk receiving, process, pre-treatment, evaporation and drying areas by identifying and analyzing process problems and advising and guiding processing operators on action required to resolve process system malfunctions in order to ensure efficient running of the plant * Ensure planning and effective implementation of sanitary/mechanical maintenance and preventive maintenance programs and schedules * Follow and administer Quality Policies and Procedures including food safety, HAACP, POGS, traceability, and production hold investigations Working with Canada Royal Milk The best part of working at Canada Royal Milk will be your opportunity to shape it. We’ll be spending the next few months developing our team, and as an early member, you’ll have plenty of input. That means you’ll contribute to our success in many ways: everything from shaping our team and processes, to execution and growth. Qualifications * Demonstrated leadership and supervisory experience: ability to influence and engage employees * Prior technical experience in processing and packaging in food manufacturing * Exceptional English communication (verbal and written) skills required * Experience working in a dairy processing is desired * Knowledge of HACCP and other food safety procedures and regulations, including traceability and production hold investigations * Certified and/or experience in the supervisory responsibilities under WSIB, OSHA, and First Aid an asset * Post-secondary education in industrial engineering, automated production engineering, food engineering or other relevant discipline How to Apply Our online application gives you the chance to apply as more than just a resume. We’ll assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, which should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll be able to view your results. We strive to build diverse teams that reflect the community, and encourage applications from underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button. We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment and look forward to hearing from you.

Our new plant is entering commercial production and we are looking for experienced leaders ready to take the next step in their career. Your tasks will include: * Provide leadership and supervision to staff by providing work direction, performance feedback, and recommendations for training and development * Promote a positive working environment, including continuously improving/maintaining the team culture and establishing high levels of employee involvement; * Troubleshoot milk receiving, process, pre-treatment, evaporation and drying areas by identifying and analyzing process problems and advising and guiding processing operators on action required to resolve process system malfunctions in order to ensure efficient running of the plant * Ensure planning and effective implementation of sanitary/mechanical maintenance and preventive maintenance programs and schedules * Follow and administer Quality Policies and Procedures including food safety, HAACP, POGS, traceability, and production hold investigations Working with Canada Royal Milk The best part of working at Canada Royal Milk will be your opportunity to shape it. We’ll be spending the next few months developing our team, and as an early member, you’ll have plenty of input. That means you’ll contribute to our success in many ways: everything from shaping our team and processes, to execution and growth. Qualifications * Demonstrated leadership and supervisory experience: ability to influence and engage employees * Prior technical experience in processing and packaging in food manufacturing * Exceptional English communication (verbal and written) skills required * Experience working in a dairy processing is desired * Knowledge of HACCP and other food safety procedures and regulations, including traceability and production hold investigations * Certified and/or experience in the supervisory responsibilities under WSIB, OSHA, and First Aid an asset * Post-secondary education in industrial engineering, automated production engineering, food engineering or other relevant discipline How to Apply Our online application gives you the chance to apply as more than just a resume. We’ll assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, which should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll be able to view your results. We strive to build diverse teams that reflect the community, and encourage applications from underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button. We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment and look forward to hearing from you.
